entries.meaning: One who, or that which, roots; one that tears up by the roots.
One who roots or rummages through something.
examples: Like so many of the self-made industry emperors of the late 1800s, he had been little more than a pawnshop rooter masquerading in collector's clothing, a connoisseur of canvas monstrosities, trashy novels and poetry collections  […]

entries.meaning: (US, slang) One who roots for, or applauds, something.
examples: My oldest brother is a hefty twelve years older; we never quite bonded, though he's always been my supporter—a real rooter for me in academic studies.
